# Recipe: Instapot Beef and Broccoli

## Introduction
Instapot Beef and Broccoli is a popular Chinese-American dish that combines tender beef slices and crisp broccoli florets in a savory sauce. This recipe is cooked using an Instant Pot, which helps to infuse the flavors and tenderize the meat quickly. It is a delicious and nutritious meal that can be served with steamed rice or noodles.

## Ingredients
- 1 pound (450g) beef sirloin, thinly sliced
- 2 cups broccoli florets
- 1/2 cup low-sodium soy sauce
- 1/4 cup oyster sauce
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1/2 cup beef broth
- Optional: sliced green onions and sesame seeds for garnish

## Equipment
- Instant Pot or pressure cooker
- Cutting board
- Knife
- Mixing bowl
- Measuring cups and spoons
- Tongs or spatula

## Preparation Time
- 15 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 15 minutes (plus time for the Instant Pot to come to pressure and release pressure)

## Steps
1. In a mixing bowl, combine the soy sauce, oyster sauce, brown sugar, minced garlic, and cornstarch. Stir well to dissolve the sugar and cornstarch.
2. Set the Instant Pot to sauté mode and heat the vegetable oil. Add the beef slices and cook until browned on all sides, about 3-4 minutes.
3. Pour the prepared sauce over the beef in the Instant Pot. Add the beef broth and stir to combine.
4. Close the Instant Pot lid and set the valve to the sealing position. Cook on high pressure for 8 minutes.
5. Once the cooking time is complete, do a quick pressure release by carefully turning the valve to the venting position.
6. Open the Instant Pot lid and add the broccoli florets. Stir to combine with the beef and sauce.
7. Close the lid again and set the valve to the sealing position. Cook on high pressure for an additional 2 minutes.
8. After the cooking time is complete, do a quick pressure release again.
9. Carefully open the Instant Pot lid and give the beef and broccoli a final stir. The sauce should have thickened slightly.
10. Serve the Instapot Beef and Broccoli over steamed rice or noodles. Garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds, if desired.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Instapot Beef and Broccoli over steamed white rice or cooked noodles.
- Pair it with a side of stir-fried vegetables or a fresh salad for a complete meal.

## Variations
- For a spicier version, add red pepper flakes or Sriracha sauce to the sauce mixture.
- Substitute the beef with chicken or tofu for a different protein option.
- Add other vegetables like bell peppers, carrots, or snap peas for added color and flavor.

## Tips and Tricks
- Slice the beef against the grain to ensure tenderness.
- Use low-sodium soy sauce to control the saltiness of the dish.
- If you prefer a thicker sauce, mix an additional teaspoon of cornstarch with cold water and add it during the final cooking step.

## Nutritional Information
- The nutritional information may vary depending on the specific ingredients used and the portion size. Here is an approximate breakdown for one serving of Instapot Beef and Broccoli:
  - Calories: 350
  - Fat: 12g
  - Carbohydrates: 20g
  - Protein: 40g
  - Fiber: 4g
  - Sodium: 1000mg

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftovers of Instapot Beef and Broccoli in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- Reheat the leftovers in a microwave or on the stovetop until heated through.

## Frequently Asked Questions
- Q: Can I use frozen broccoli for this recipe?
  - A: Yes, you can use frozen broccoli. Simply add it to the Instant Pot along with the beef and adjust the cooking time accordingly.
- Q: Can I use a different cut of beef?
  - A: Yes, you can use other cuts like flank steak or ribeye. Just make sure to slice the beef thinly for quicker cooking.
- Q: Can I make this recipe without an Instant Pot?
  - A: Yes, you can make Beef and Broccoli on the stovetop. Sauté the beef in a skillet, add the sauce and broccoli, and simmer until cooked through.
